subject: Photography
title: Surveillance and the Camera
description: Learn Surveillance and the Camera in one minute.

hook.text: London has over 600,000 surveillance cameras. You're photographed hundreds of times daily. Who's watching?

buildup.text: Surveillance photography expanded from government security to commercial tracking, facial recognition, and control.

discovery.text: CCTV, facial recognition, and satellite imagery give authorities the ability to track individuals at massive scale.

twist.text: The same technology that protects also oppresses. In some countries, cameras enforce authoritarian control.

climax.text: The debate isn't whether to use cameras ‚Äî it's who controls them, who sees the footage, and who decides.

punchline.text: The question isn't 'who's watching?' It's 'who decides?'

quiz.question: What is the central ethical concern with surveillance photography?
options: Who controls the cameras and how the footage is used
The image quality of CCTV cameras
